intro: Ricinocarpus subtomentosus, commonly known as the hairy ricinocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in mangrove forests. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
